title.narrative: Support to the Mekong Delta Conference 2019

description.narrative: The Mekong Delta is critical for the development of Vietnam and also for regional food security; the Delta produces 50% of Vietnam’s rice (90% for export) and 70% of its aquaculture products. Over the last decade or so, a number of natural and anthropogenic changes are placing significant development pressures on the Mekong Delta. Furthermore, climate change is expected to further threaten lives, livelihoods and assets in the Mekong Delta. Coastal populations in the Mekong Delta have been identified as being especially vulnerable to the impacts of climate change, including sea-level rise and the projected increase in tropical cyclones intensity. Rice yields in the Mekong Delta are expected to decline from 6–12 percent due to resulting inundation and salinity intrusion, while aquaculture production will also be affected.The Government of Vietnam recognizes the threats and has started to develop a more holistic vision to manage the current and future risks and opportunities in the Delta. It works with the World Bank and several bilateral partners on an integrated long-term and sustainable development. Such an approach cuts across different sectors and institutional levels with the overall objective to identify and prioritize “low regret” climate resilient infrastructure and non-structural measures for the Mekong Delta, and to build regional and provincial-level planning capacity for making integrated and resilient decisions. As part of this process further incorporating stakeholder engagement on climate resilient investments screening and planning processes is essential. To fill this gap, the World Bank together with several bilateral donors organized a (second) Mekong Delta Conference (MDC) in Ho Chi Minh City (HCMC). The MDC drew between 500-800 participants from provincial governments, national government, DPs, academia, CSOs as well as private sector. It consisted of interactive progress reporting with presentations, panels and group discussions to give voice to provincial departments. It also aimed to facilitate discussions solutions and climate resilient investments (information, institution and infrastructure), Delta development objectives, and trade-offs across the transport, agriculture and water sectors.This project is conducted in cooperation with: Government of Vietnam and the World Bank Vietnam.
